1.text: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women came to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared.

2.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,

3.text: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.text: While they were puzzling over this, suddenly two men in radiant apparel stood beside them.

5.text: As the women bowed their faces to the ground in terror, the two men asked them, “Why do you look for the living among the dead?

6.text: He is not here; He has risen! Remember how He told you while He was still in Galilee:

7.text: ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.’”

9.text: And when they returned from the tomb, they reported all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.

10.text: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told this to the apostles.

11.text: But their words seemed like nonsense to them, and they did not believe the women.

12.text: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. And after bending down and seeing only the linen cloths, he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.

13.text: That same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.

14.text: They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.

15.text: And as they talked and deliberated, Jesus Himself came up and walked along with them.

16.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing Him.

17.text: He asked them, “What are you discussing so intently as you walk along?” They stood still, with sadness on their faces.

18.text: One of them, named Cleopas, asked Him, “Are You the only visitor to Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened there in recent days?”

19.text: “What things?” He asked. “The events involving Jesus of Nazareth,” they answered. “This man was a prophet, powerful in speech and action before God and all the people.

20.text: Our chief priests and rulers delivered Him up to the sentence of death, and they crucified Him.

21.text: But we were hoping He was the One who would redeem Israel. And besides all this, it is the third day since these things took place.

22.text: Furthermore, some of our women astounded us. They were at the tomb early this morning,

23.text: but they did not find His body. They came and told us they had seen a vision of angels, who said that Jesus was alive.

24.text: Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had described. But Him they did not see.”

25.text: Then Jesus said to them, “O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

26.text: Was it not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and then to enter His glory?”

27.text: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, He explained to them what was written in all the Scriptures about Himself.

28.text: As they approached the village where they were headed, He seemed to be going farther.

29.text: But they pleaded with Him, “Stay with us, for it is nearly evening and the day is almost over.” So He went in to stay with them.

30.text: While He was reclining at the table with them, He took bread, spoke a blessing and broke it, and gave it to them.

31.text: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Jesus—and He disappeared from their sight.

32.text: They asked each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us as He spoke with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?”

33.text: And they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, gathered together

34.text: and saying, “The Lord has indeed risen and has appeared to Simon!”

35.text: Then the two told what had happened on the road, and how they had recognized Jesus in the breaking of the bread.

36.text: While they were describing these events, Jesus Himself stood among them and said, “Peace be with you.”

37.text: But they were startled and frightened, thinking they had seen a spirit.

38.text: “Why are you troubled,” Jesus asked, “and why do doubts arise in your hearts?

39.text: Look at My hands and My feet. It is I Myself. Touch Me and see—for a spirit does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”

40.text: And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and feet.

41.text: While they were still in disbelief because of their joy and amazement, He asked them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”

42.text: So they gave Him a piece of broiled fish,

43.text: and He took it and ate it in front of them.

44.text: Jesus said to them, “These are the words I spoke to you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about Me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms.”

45.text: Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.

46.text: And He told them, “This is what is written: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,

47.text: and in His name repentance and forgiveness of sins will be proclaimed to all nations, beginning in Jerusalem.

48.text: You are witnesses of these things.

49.text: And behold, I am sending the promise of My Father upon you. But remain in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”

50.text: When Jesus had led them out as far as Bethany, He lifted up His hands and blessed them.

51.text: While He was blessing them, He left them and was carried up into heaven.

52.text: And they worshiped Him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,

53.text: praising God continually in the temple.
